Finance & Accounts Manager Job at Obor Logistics Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Obor Logistics Nigeria Limited is a leading logistics company specializing in freight forwarding, warehousing, transportation management, supply chain optimization. With a strong network of global partners and a team of experienced professionals, we deliver tailored solutions to meet the unique needs of our clients across various industries. We offer customized and complete air and sea import/export international freight solutions based on volume, weight and required delivery timing. Our services include all kind of international freight, door-to-door logistics, warehousing, storing and distribution, traceability system, customs operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance & Accounts Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Apapa, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Financial management reporting
	Bookkeeping and records
	Budget forecasting
	Taxation and compliance
	Internal control and audit
	Treasury and cash flow management
	Accounts payable and receivable.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates shoud possess a Bachelor's Degree with 2-8 years of experience.


Salary
N150,000 - N500,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: nnaji.stella@linkafri.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Internal Auditor Job at West African Examinations Council




        
    

        
        The West African Examinations Council is a sub-regional organisation responsible for conducting various examinations in the English-speaking West African countries.

Applications are hereby invited from qualified persons to fill the vacant position below in its Nigeria National Office:

Job Position: Internal Auditor

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Specific Duties and Responsibilities
The successful applicant will be assigned duties in the Audit Department of the WAEC International Office, Lagos and will be required to assist in:
     

            
    




	Evaluating Internal Control and making recommendations on improvements. Evaluating the reliability, sufficiency and validity of accounting and relevant data (Information).
	Objectively assessing IT/business process, identify shortfalls and gaps.
	Ensuring compliance with policies, procedures, relevant Laws and statutes.
	Assuring safeguards of assets.
	Preparing timely periodic reports for Management consideration.
	Evaluating whether risks relating to strategic objectives are identified and managed appropriately.
	Any other duties that may be assigned.


Qualifications and Experience
Applicants must:


	Possess a Bachelor's Degree (at least Second Class Lower Division) in Accounting or any other relevant discipline.
	Have a minimum of three (3) years of post NYSC relevant work experience.
	Be an associate member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN) or Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA) or ACA.


General Requirements


	Candidates must be able to use personal computers, office software package and have knowledge of web- based systems;
	They must be self-motivated and able to write good reports; analyse and review research reports.
	They must be able to work extra hours with little or no supervision.
	They must be a team player with good inter-personal skills and be open and able to lead change; possess influencing, analytical and communication skills.
	They must be an organiser/planner with ability to be flexible and be able to successfully implement ideas.


Note


	All Applicants must possess five (5) credits in WASSCE / SSCE / GCE 'O' Level including English Language and Mathematics at a sitting, or six (6) credits including English Language and Mathematics at not more than two (2) sittings.
	Applicants should not be more than forty (40) years of age as at the close of the advertisement.
	They must have also undergone the mandatory one (1) year National Youth Service.


Salary and Conditions of Service


	The salary paid by the Council are very attractive.
	Point of entry into the salary scales will depend on qualifications and experience.
	The successful applicants will enjoy very good remuneration package that is in line with Council's Conditions of Service and will also be assured of full career development within the organisation.


Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

  "description": "The West African Examinations Council is&nbsp;a sub-regional organisation responsible for conducting various examinations in the English-speaking West African countries.

Applications are hereby invited from qualified persons to fill the vacant position below in its Nigeria National Office:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Specific Duties and Responsibilities
The successful applicant will be required to perform the following duties, among others, in the Finance Division:


	Prepare and monitor annual budgets.
	Conduct financial and cost analysis.
	Prepare reports for Council meetings.
	Prepare financial statements in compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
	Supervise all Accounts staff in his/her office.
	Oversee the input and management of financial data and reports for the Council.
	Analyse revenue and expenditure trends and recommend appropriate budgetary controls.
	Advise on cost reduction strategies and cash flow improvement.
	Liaise with Internal and External Auditors during audit exercises.
	Serve as a statutory member of the designated Management Committees.
	Perform any other duties as may be assigned by the Head of Office.


Qualifications and Experience
Applicants must:


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Accounting or any other related course of study with at least Second Class Lower Division.
	Have at least three (3) years of post-NYSC professional experience.
	Be an Associate member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN) or Association of National Accountants of Nigeria (ANAN) or Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA UK)/ Institute of Chartered Accountants, UK (ACA); Be able to use at least one Accounting Package.


General Requirements


	Candidates must&nbsp;be able to use personal computers, office software packages and have knowledge of web-based systems;
	They must be self-motivated and able to write good reports, analyse and review research reports.

Accountant Job at West African Examinations Council




        
    

        
        The West African Examinations Council is a sub-regional organisation responsible for conducting various examinations in the English-speaking West African countries.

Applications are hereby invited from qualified persons to fill the vacant position below in its Nigeria National Office:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Specific Duties and Responsibilities
The successful applicant will be required to perform the following duties, among others, in the Finance Division:
     

            
    




	Prepare and monitor annual budgets.
	Conduct financial and cost analysis.
	Prepare reports for Council meetings.
	Prepare financial statements in compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
	Supervise all Accounts staff in his/her office.
	Oversee the input and management of financial data and reports for the Council.
	Analyse revenue and expenditure trends and recommend appropriate budgetary controls.
	Advise on cost reduction strategies and cash flow improvement.
	Liaise with Internal and External Auditors during audit exercises.
	Serve as a statutory member of the designated Management Committees.
	Perform any other duties as may be assigned by the Head of Office.


Qualifications and Experience
Applicants must:


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or any other related course of study with at least Second Class Lower Division.
	Have at least three (3) years of post-NYSC professional experience.
	Be an Associate member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN) or Association of National Accountants of Nigeria (ANAN) or Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA UK)/ Institute of Chartered Accountants, UK (ACA); Be able to use at least one Accounting Package.


General Requirements


	Candidates must be able to use personal computers, office software packages and have knowledge of web-based systems;
	They must be self-motivated and able to write good reports, analyse and review research reports.
	They must be able to work extra hours with little or no supervision.
	They must be a team player with good inter-personal skills and be open and able to lead change; possess influencing, analytical and communication skills.
	They must be an organiser/planner with the ability to be flexible and be able to successfully implement ideas.
	Note: All Applicants must possess five (5) credits in WASSCE / SSCE / GCE 'O' Level, including English Language and Mathematics at a sitting, or six (6) credits including English Language and Mathematics at not more than two (2) sittings.
	Applicants should not be more than forty (40) years of age as at the close of the advertisement.
	They must have also undergone the mandatory one (1) year National Youth Service.


Salary and Conditions of Service


	The salaries paid by the Council are very attractive.
	Point of entry into the salary scales will depend on qualifications and experience.
	The successful applicants will enjoy a very good remuneration package that is in line with the Council's Conditions of Service and will also be assured of full career development within the organisation.


Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Java Software Engineer Job at Interswitch




        
    

        
        Interswitch is an Africa-focused integrated digital payments and commerce company that facilitates the electronic circulation of money as well as the exchange of value between individuals and organisations on a timely and consistent basis. We started operations in 2002 as a transaction switching and electronic payments processing, and have progressively evolved into an integrated payment services company, building and managing payment infrastructure as well as delivering innovative payment products and transactional services throughout the African continent. At Interswitch, we offer unique career opportunities for individuals capable of playing key roles and adding value in an innovative and fun environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Java Software Engineer 

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria

About the job


	We are seeking an experienced Back End Software Engineer who will be responsible for building and maintaining scalable, secure, and high-performing backend systems.
	The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of software engineering principles, experience working with a range of technologies, and a passion for creating innovative solutions to complex problems.


Responsibilities


	Design and develop RESTful APIs and microservices that power our web and mobile applications.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize features, requirements, and technical solutions that will drive innovation.
	Lead the design and implementation of scalable and maintainable software architecture that meets functional and non-functional requirements.
	Implement security measures to protect our systems and data.
	Develop automated tests and participate in code reviews to ensure the quality and reliability of the software.
	Mentor and coach other team members to improve their technical skills and contribute to the overall success of the team.
	Stay up-to-date with the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in backend development.


Position Requirements


	Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
	3+ years of experience in back-end software engineering.
	Expertise in at least one programming language such as Java, Python, or Node.js.
	Experience with relational and/or NoSQL databases, such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.
	Knowledge of cloud-based computing platforms, such as AWS or Azure.
	Understanding of software development methodologies, including agile and DevOps.
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Experience leading technical initiatives and mentoring other engineers.


Preferred:


	Experience with serverless architecture, such as AWS Lambda or Azure Functions.
	Knowledge of message queueing systems, such as Kafka or RabbitMQ.
	Familiarity with containerization technologies, such as Docker and Kubernetes.
	Experience working in an innovation lab or startup environment results.


Note: Due to the high volume of applications, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
